result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca E. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $100 monthly starting the first day of the first month 30 days following release from confinement. Restitution is to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court's Office. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with Tiffeny Schneider directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca E. Clark

records.addlTxt: 20CF192, 21CF101, 21CF258 & 22CF19 Cases called @ 2:32 PM Defendant Rebecca E. Clark in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Rebecca E. Clark.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant had previously entered a plea on cases 21CF101, 21CF258 & 22CF19.  Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court orders: 20CF192 - 1 year WC Jail - NO Huber, GT, 230 days CFTS, sentence to commence forthwith. 21CF101: All counts - S/W 5 years probation. 21CF258: Cts 1 & 4 - S/W 5 years probation, Ct 3 - S/W 1 year probation. 22CF19: S/W 5 years probation. Conditions: As to Ct 1 of 21CF258 only - 12 mos WC Jail consecutive to 20CF192 - Huber, No GT, No CFTS, the Court leaves the decision of a jail transfer to the discretion of the jail.  As to all counts - AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Any counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent, No contact with T.S., Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 22CF19 - Rest $976.34 - to be repaid in monthly increment of no less than $100 starting the first day of the first month 30 days following release from confinement.

20CF192, 21CF101, 21CF258 & 22CF19 Cases called @ 4:15 PM Defendant Rebecca E. Clark in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Rebecca E. Clark.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. 21CF258 - The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived. 21CF101, 21CF258 & 22CF19 - Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 21CF101: Cts 1 & 3 - NC. 21CF258: Cts 1, 3 & 4 - NC. 22CF19: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 21CF101: Cts 2, 4, 5, 6 & 7 - DRI. 21CF258: Cts 2, 5 & 6 - DRI. 20CF192: The parties have received the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be noted. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Sentencing argument by ADA Ryan. Sentencing argument by Atty Zamzow. The Court adjourns the sentencing hearing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared by phone for Rebecca E. Clark. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Zamzow advises that the defendant is going through the revocation process. The Court will schedule a P/S.

Case called @ 1:02 PM Defendant Rebecca E. Clark appeared in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Zamzow. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived. NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.
Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Status conference on February 22, 2022 at 09:40 am.
